channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Gay marriage cases: 5 things to watch
item.description: After years of struggle on both sides of the issue, the question of same-sex marriage goes before the U.S. Supreme Court this week. People were already lining up outside the court Friday morning for the limited number of seats available Tuesday and Wednesday, when the justices will hear oral arguments on two cases.

item.title: Couple fights for right to marry
item.description: With equal amounts enthusiasm and charm, Jeff Zarrillo and Paul Katami call themselves "regulars guys," and "loudmouths" to boot. Their once low-key love affair has put the couple from Burbank, California, in the national spotlight -- co-plaintiffs in a monumental fight now before the Supreme Court that tests the generations-old concept of marriage.

item.title: Right to spouse benefits at stake
item.description: The wedding photo shows the happy couple poised to kiss, ready to begin an adventure that has now taken them to the U.S. Supreme Court.

item.title: Joe Weider dies; gave hope to scrawny
item.description: A bodybuilding icon. A fitness innovator. A magazine publisher. A mentor to one of the world's biggest action heroes. A pioneer. Joe Weider was all those things and more in his 93 years, right up until his death Saturday morning at a Los Angeles hospital.

item.title: How to spell trouble: B-I-N-G-O
item.description: A young man faces a misdemeanor charge for yelling "Bingo!" in a crowded bingo hall.

item.title: Couple loses 500 pounds in 2 years
item.description: Angela and Willie Gillis have been best friends for more than 10 years, married for three. Their individual strengths balance the other's weaknesses. They credit this balance with helping them lose a combined 500 pounds.

item.title: Why billboard is grabbing attention
item.description: A billboard in Minnesota knows how to get your attention when it comes to the importance of a colonoscopy. KARE reports.

item.title: Tom Hanks would re-do this film ...
item.description: Actor Tom Hanks talks to CNN's Piers Morgan about a movie he would like to redo.

item.title: No reopening in sight for Ellis Island
item.description: For more than 60 years the facility was the gateway for millions of immigrants to the United States. Now the National Park Service can't say when it will reopen because of severe damage from Superstorm Sandy.

item.title: No one has right to redefine marriage
item.description: "Pediatrics Group Backs Gay Marriage, Saying It Helps Children," proclaims a headline in The New York Times. But the advocacy group presented no new studies, no new data, to support this claim. And the studies the group cites have been shown to be insufficient to come to this conclusion about same-sex parenting.

item.title: A lesson in values from Mick Jagger
item.description: Here are six words I thought I'd never hear myself say: "I can relate to Mick Jagger."

item.title: Young women ambitious, but worried
item.description: Orit Avishai: My female college students -- future doctors, lawyers, bankers -- worry about work-life balance.

item.title: 'I'm so afraid to have any more babies'
item.description: The fatal shooting last week of a 13-month-old boy in his stroller marked the second time mother Sherry West lost a son to violence, she said.

item.title: 911 call: 'A baby has been shot!'
item.description: Police released 911 tapes in the Georgia case of a baby shot and killed in a stroller. Nick Valencia reports.

item.title: Berezovsky's last days studied
item.description: Boris Berezovsky made a fortune in Russia before fleeing to England. He accused the Kremlin of poisoning a former Russian spy. Berezovsky's body was found Saturday and questions are swirling.

item.title: Quantico shooter was tactics instructor
item.description: Military officials have released the names of the gunman and two victims killed at a Marine base in Quantico, Virginia.

item.title: One $338 million winning ticket sold
item.description: A winning ticket for Saturday night's $338 million Powerball jackpot was sold in New Jersey, lottery officials said early Sunday.

item.title: President flees capital as gunfire rages
item.description: The president of the Central African Republic fled the country's capital Sunday as violence erupted between rebels and the government, France's foreign minister said.

item.title: Family vacation turns tragic at airport
item.description: Other members of Luke Bresette's family were seriously injured when an arrivals/departures sign fell on them while they were at an Alabama airport.

item.title: Rapper wanted after nightclub incident
item.description: Atlanta police have issued an arrest warrant for rapper Gucci Mane who allegedly struck a man on the head with a champagne bottle at a downtown Atlanta nightclub.

item.title: Leno takes shots at NBC bosses
item.description: Jay Leno's alleged feud with NBC inspires jokes on "The Tonight Show."

item.title: Katie Holmes nearly topless in new ad
item.description: Actress Katie Holmes poses nearly nude in a new high-end jewelry campaign. HLN's A.J. Hammer has more.

item.title: JT: Mouseketeer to megastar
item.description: Justin Timberlake is an Entertainer. That's JT, with a capital "E": Everyman, Everything and Everywhere right now.

item.title: Photos: Child stars all grown up
New show 'too white'?
item.description: HBO's 'Girls' is the latest TV show depicting life in New York City without one of its most crucial elements: diversity.

item.title: Zimmerman's body language
item.description: An expert in body language says George Zimmerman showed signs of anger in court in Florida.

item.title: Anderson battles on 'Jeopardy!'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper reflects on the highs and lows of his past "Jeopardy" appearances and weighs his odds of winning.

item.title: Steinem on GOP and women
item.description: Activist and author Gloria Steinem analyzes the "war on women" and says extremists have taken over the Republican party.

item.title: Facebook fans 'lonely'?
item.description: A report on Facebook, Bill O'Reilly and the Fox "brand," Current TV"s new hire, a Pulitzer for a PA reporter, GMA rises

item.title: Working moms of CNN
item.description: CNN goes behind the scenes with the working moms on Suzanne Malveaux's team to see how they juggle it all.

item.title: Levon Helm remembered
item.description: Anderson Cooper takes a look back at the life of The Band's Levon Helm and his many contributions to music.

item.title: Man makes dating spreadsheet
item.description: Soledad O'Brien discusses the investment banker who created an elaborate spreadsheet to keep track of his dates.

item.title: Political dog tale duel
item.description: In the RidicuList, Anderson Cooper examines which candidate's dog tale will have a greater election impact.

item.title: Vanessa Williams' perfect man
item.description: Entertainer Vanessa Williams talks to CNN's Piers Morgan about "being properly in love" and relationships.

item.title: 'Only in America': Defending Axl Rose
item.description: Piers Morgan defends Axl Rose for deciding not to attend the Rock'N'Roll Hall of Fame induction of Guns N' Roses.

item.title: Rep. won't name 'Communists'
item.description: Rep. Allen West (R-FL) responds to criticism after he claimed a number of Democratic reps in Congress are Communists.

item.title: RidicuList: Quest for 'sexy veggies'
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper riffs on a staple of Courtney Stodden's grocery list, "sexy veggies."

item.title: Kim Kardashian for mayor?
item.description: Soledad O'Brien discusses Kim Kardashian's comments about running for Mayor in Glendale, California.

item.title: New judge in Martin case
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett speaks to a panel of analysts about the new judge in the Trayvon Martin shooting case.

item.title: Justin Timberlake through the years
Photos: Child stars all grown up
A history of David Bowie in 15 objects
item.description: David Bowie always did have impeccable timing. He released his song about a doomed astronaut, "Space Oddity," just days before the 1969 Moon landing. Four years later he killed off his most famous creation, the other-worldly "Ziggy Stardust," just at the point it threatened to overwhelm him.

item.title: High fashion in the Low Country
item.description: Not all fashion designers are bred in Paris and New York. Fashion weeks outside the industry capitals give aspiring designers a chance to shine.

item.title: Photos: Charleston Fashion Week
item.description: Charleston Fashion Week

item.title: Is he New York's nanny-in-chief?
item.description: His moves to keep New Yorkers away from cigarettes and fattening foods have triggered cries of a nanny state. Yet, Michael Bloomberg's supporters say his public health initiatives are working.

item.title: Dog has his own seeing-eye dog
item.description: CNN photojournalist John Torigoe introduces you to Issac, a blind dog, and his friend Isabella who guides him.

item.title: North Korea's war video threatens U.S.
item.description: North Korea's tanks, troops and missiles target the U.S. in a new video. CNN's Chris Lawrence reports.

item.title: Gerard Butler explains this kiss
item.description: CNN's Piers Morgan asks actor Gerard Butler about this kiss with director Paul Haggis.

item.title: Rainbow house gets revenge on Westboro
item.description: A house is painted in rainbow colors to counteract anti-gay neighbors. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: The county where no one's gay
item.description: CNN's John Sutter visits Franklin County, Mississippi, where, according to one Census analysis, is home to zero same-sex couples.

item.title: North Korea threats: 5 things to know
item.description: Video propaganda showing the White House blown up. Talk of hitting U.S. bases. The renunciation of a 60-year-old armistice that has peace on the Korean Peninsula. What is North Korea's young leader doing?

item.title: Hey, how'd that get up there?
item.description: The husband and wife left for a night on the town.

item.title: Possible meteor spotted in Delaware
item.description: A security camera at an automobile dealership catches what some think was a meteor in the night sky. Take a look.

item.title: Dog has his own seeing-eye dog
item.description: CNN photojournalist John Torigoe introduces you to Issac, a blind dog, and his friend Isabella who guides him.

item.title: Dramatic video of driver vs. tornado
item.description: CNN's Erin Burnett reports on dramatic video of a tornado in Australia.

item.title: Triple shooting caught on tape
item.description: The Philadelphia Police Deptartment released video of a non-fatal triple shooting to identify the suspect.

item.title: Gray whale sneaks up on 15-foot boat
item.description: Gray Whales greeted a 15-foot fishing boat off California. A whale watching tour caught the encounter on tape.

item.title: Kabooyow! Woman's interview is viral hit
item.description: A Texas woman's animated response to a hail storm has gone viral. KPRC reports.

item.title: Baby killed
item.description: The woman was so distraught, she had to hand her phone to another passer-by. "The baby is not breathing," he told the operator, according to 911 tapes. The 13-month-old was shot Thursday in his stroller.

item.title: Boris Berezovsky
item.description: Russian oligarch Boris Berezovsky, 67, and others like him gulped up businesses on the cheap after the fall of communism. He made a lot of money -- and enemies.

item.title: East Coast meteor
item.description: The streaking ball of fire Friday night above the East Coast did not, for now at least, signal the end to civilization as we know it.

item.title: Obama's Mideast trip
item.description: U.S. President Barack Obama wraps up his trip to the Middle East on Saturday with a walking tour of the ancient city of Petra in Jordan.

item.title: North Korea
item.description: Video propaganda showing the White House and Congress being blown up. Talk of hitting U.S. bases in the Pacific. The reunciation of a 60-year-old armistice that has kept the tenuous peace on the Korean Peninsula.

item.title: Same-sex marriage
item.description: The wedding photo shows the happy couple poised to kiss, ready to begin an adventure that has now taken them to the U.S. Supreme Court.

People we lost in 2013
